After read a lot of posts about JTest and JUnit I just
wanted to make a plug for a great and free tool. Its
called PMD (http://pmd.sf.net)

JTest had some source code analysis stuff that could be
neat, this project has it also and is free. It works on
your java source code and helps developers to conform
to coding idioms (not code standards). It will scan your
source code for potential problems and if you follow
the rules/suggestion you will get code that is simplier
and more maintable.


It even has rules for coping with JUnit tests, so check it
out and it will help you get a better code. There are
plugins for most common Java IDEs.


<copied from project page>
PMD scans Java source code and looks for potential problems like:

  a.. Unused local variables
  b.. Empty catch blocks
  c.. Unused parameters
  d.. Empty 'if' statements
  e.. Duplicate import statements
  f.. Unused private methods
  g.. Classes which could be Singletons
  h.. Short/long variable and method names
  i.. A lot more
Sorry about this, but I just wanted everyone aware about
this neat tool to be used TOGETHER with JUnit.
